page.title: 17Local Housing
page.content: Timbercliffe is a housing estate which was built by Fothergill and Harvey for their workers.They were built from the ash from the boilers.Now they are not owned by Fothergill & Harvey but are private. There is a council estate,Barnes Meadows and the houses are being rebuilt because the concrete frames on the houses were cracking.People had to be rehoused and many children in our school were affected. Summit is Victorian and Edwardian ribbon development.They are stone houses and cottages made from local stone.There are quite a lot of old settlements such as Salley Street.They were built in the 17-18th century and were handloom weavers cottages.There are also quite a lot of farm settle- ments some have been converted into dwellings but some are still farms.
